p: A linear model testing copepod species and temperature category as predictors of predation efficiency explained 6.8% of the variance in predation efficiency ( Table 1). The predation efficiency of M. viridis copepods was 25.7%, significantly higher (p-value = 0.0288) than that of M. albidus copepods, which had a predation efficiency of 18.2%, when controlling for differences in temperature ( Table 1, Fig 3A). Interactions between species and temperature were not significant (Species x Temperature 20, p-value = 0.150; Species x Temperature 25, p-value = 0.466).
